metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7663 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: websocket-extensions ruby module prior to 0.1.5 allows Denial of Service (DoS) via Regex Backtracking. The extension parser may take quadratic time when parsing a header containing an unclosed string parameter value whose content is a repeating two-byte sequence of a backslash and some other character. This could be abused by an attacker to conduct Regex Denial Of Service (ReDoS) on a single-threaded server by providing a malicious payload with the Sec-WebSocket-Extensions header.

criterions.comment: ruby-websocket-extensions package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.1.5-1').
